Package org.apache.juneau.commons.collections

Class FilteredList.Builder<E>

java.lang.Object
org.apache.juneau.commons.collections.FilteredList.Builder<E>
Type Parameters:
E - The element type.
Enclosing class:
FilteredList<E>
public static class FilteredList.Builder<E> extends Object
Builder for creating FilteredList instances.
Example:

FilteredList<Integer> list = FilteredList .create(Integer.class) .filter(v -> v != null && v > 0) .inner(new ArrayList<>()) .build();

  • Method Details

    • filter

      public FilteredList.Builder<E> filter(Predicate<E> value)
      Sets the filter predicate that determines whether elements should be added.

      The predicate receives the element value. If it returns true, the element is added to the list. If it returns false, the element is silently ignored.

      This method is optional. If not called, the list will accept all elements (defaults to v -> true).

      This method can be called multiple times. When called multiple times, all filters are combined using AND logic - an element must pass all filters to be added to the list.

      Example:

      // Filter out null values Builder<String> b = FilteredList.create(String.class) .filter(v -> v != null); // Filter based on value Builder<Integer> b2 = FilteredList.create(Integer.class) .filter(v -> v != null && v > 0); // Multiple filters combined with AND Builder<Integer> b3 = FilteredList.create(Integer.class) .filter(v -> v != null) // First filter .filter(v -> v > 0) // Second filter (ANDed with first) .filter(v -> v < 100); // Third filter (ANDed with previous)

      Parameters:
      value - The filter predicate. Must not be null.
      Returns:
      This object for method chaining.

    • inner

      public FilteredList.Builder<E> inner(List<E> value)
      Sets the underlying list instance that will store the filtered elements.

      If not specified, a new ArrayList will be created during build().

      Example:

      // Use a LinkedList Builder<String> b = FilteredList.create(String.class) .inner(new LinkedList<>()); // Use a CopyOnWriteArrayList for thread safety Builder<String> b2 = FilteredList.create(String.class) .inner(new CopyOnWriteArrayList<>()); // Use an existing list List<String> existing = new ArrayList<>(); Builder<String> b3 = FilteredList.create(String.class) .inner(existing);

      Parameters:
      value - The underlying list instance. Must not be null.
      Returns:
      This object for method chaining.

    • elementFunction

      public FilteredList.Builder<E> elementFunction(Function<Object,E> value)
      Sets the function to use for converting elements when using FilteredList.add(Object).

      If specified, elements passed to FilteredList.add(Object) will be converted using this function before being added to the list. If not specified, elements must already be of the correct type (or Object.class is used if types were not specified, which accepts any type).

      Example:

      FilteredList<Integer> list = FilteredList .create(Integer.class) .filter(v -> v != null && v > 0) .elementFunction(o -> Integer.parseInt(o.toString())) .build(); list.add("123"); // Element will be converted from String to Integer

      Parameters:
      value - The element conversion function. Can be null.
      Returns:
      This object for method chaining.

    • build

      public FilteredList<E> build()
      Builds a new FilteredList instance.

      If filter(Predicate) was not called, the list will accept all elements (defaults to v -> true).

      Returns:
      A new filtered list instance.
